page.title: 14ALMOND COURT.
page.content: Almond Court is where the old people are looked after.It is sheltered housing.There are twenty two bungalows and four flats.The flats are built on to the hall where the resident can play Bingo and cards and have entertainments.There is a guest room for visitors who come from a long way away to see there relations living in Almond Court.Thirty people live in Almond Court.They are all connected by intercom to the wardens house.This works 24 hours a day.The District Nurse visits as often as required.The worst illness is rheumatism.Meals on wheels are delivered on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays.The oldest resident is 96 years old and the youngest is 62.Four people drive cars. The warden is Mrs P.Freer.Lots of people like to help the old folk.Even children can help!
